We have been to this restaurant for dinner every time we have gone to Sedona. Never disappointed, great food, great service and reasonable prices for what you get. Next time we want to try breakfast.

Close to our motel, Super 8, attractive after a day's travelling. Very welcoming and friendly staff; service was good. The food was very good, too. Good location, good food and service. Recommended.

Excellent food, service and atmosphere. Waiters knowledgeable and friendly. We will go there again and will recommend to others.

We ended up here on Valentine's night for dinner and they were serving a pre fixe menu--not what we expected. But everything was delicious--especially the scallops!

Close to the Hyatt Pinon Point, the Sound Bites Grill has awesome patio views. Sadly the patio is quite small but the chairs are comfy and there are heaters for chilly days and evenings. Limited happy hour food menu. Good selection of draft beers. Staff very friendly and accommodating.

We ate outside at the bar and had a fabulous view of the red rocks. We both enjoyed our meals (blue burger and ahi poke) and beers. Service was excellent.

We stumbled across this restaurant as we first arrived in Sedona. The outdoor seating and generous glasses of wine were a fantastic start to an overall great meal.

We went to the Valentines show and saw Esteban.. Excellent show and the food was a buffet and still very good.

I love Sound Bites Grill for the great shows. They book a lot of different types of music and it is a nice venue to get something to eat and drink and listen to the music. Sometimes there is dancing too.

If you want a place with awesome views, great food, and really good music then this is your place. We actually ended up going to this place three nights in a row because of the awesome view off the deck and great food. The music was fabulous as well a couple of those nights.

This restaurant was pretty cool. The music was very loud though which made conversation tough at dinner! Food was good, drinks were good! We had a good time!

Great bar staff serving nice drinks(a bit speedy) in a great musical atmosphere. We didn't get to enjoy the evenings musical entertainment however because the venue was fully booked.

We ate here on a Saturday evening just before a show started. We did not have a reservation, but getting seated was not a problem. Service was attentive but a bit over-obsequious in my opinion. More  



Sounds Bites lived up to the reviews and made a magical week in Sedona even more special. Great food and service but the piece pièce de résistance was a spectacular evening being wowed by Anthony Mazzella and his guitar prowess.

Creekside has a great view of Oak Creek with a fair amount of seating out on the deck. The Piggy Wings are out of this world.

The restaurant is very nice and the meal was wonderful. Our server was extremely nice and helpful when asked a question. We would go there again.

We stopped here for breakfast. We had earl gray lavender tea and decaf coffee. smokes salmon which came with amazing egg salad breakfast tacos and the broken egg sandwich. Took them a few minutes to notice an seat us.

Service was great. Steaks were amazing. Prices were reasonable and the view of the mountain was spectacular. They are known for their peach cobbler which we took to go. Most amazing cobbler I have had. Unfortunately the peaches were al dente and I have an allergy unless fully cooked so be aware.

I really enjoyed my shrimp and grits with a bit of pork belly. Good comfort food on a cool evening. My husband had the peach cobbler for two - which he mostly ate by himself without a struggle. Service was adequately attentive.

We stopped here while in Sedona. the hamburgers were amazing as were the Cactus Fries. Definitely try the cactus fries!!! My daughter got the ribs and did not like them. They took them off the bill for us. great place out front to watch the sunset.

We Canadians love patios! Any opportunity to eat outdoors in a pleasant environment is not to be missed, and this place didn't disappoint. The food was good with some interesting local items on the menu (fried cactus, anyone?). Service was fast and friendly.

Stopped for coffee. Bought a piece of homemade single slice apple pie. Crust was devine, filing perfect ( not to sweet, but great!!!) Went back the next day for more! Next time will try their sandwiches.

Just stopped off on the way through and the polite, friendly young lady took great care to make 2 wonderful cups of coffee. The store and lodge check-in areas have some great features from the white piano, through old camera collection to the wonderful 'fridge unit. We sat on the deck listening to the river and wildlife - very relaxing.

A serendipitous lunch here that turned out to be absolutely awesome! Food was incredible. Staff very friendly. Perfect seating outside in the sunshine looking at the canyon walls. Highly recommended!!

Robot like people put together your sandwich lacking flair, enthusiasm, kindness.
Deadwood feeling , eat fresh/eat fast and scram !

McDonalds here locally has high work standards and great training, what a difference a mile makes ?

title: Full Moon Saloon, Sedona

review_list:
We stopped here after touring the area all day. Steak was delicious and cooked to perfection. Rattlesnake trio was a great conversation piece as a starter. Service friendly and efficient. Very well situated for all Sedona attractions, right opposite Pink Jeep Tours HQ.

The western-style atmosphere is fun and makes this place a good stop. We stopped in the afternoon to refresh from our adventures with a beer and appetizers. We had the sampler plate of appetizers because we wanted to try the rattlesnake and prickly pear fries, which were OK.

I visited this restaurant on a Saturday morning and the food was Very good. Their cups of coffee are gigantic and the food is prepared fresh to order. I ad the Open Face Egg sandwich, which was excellent. It was 2 eggs cooked medium served on toast with roasted asparagus, goat cheese and fresh dill. Very good.

Would you like to try rattlesnake or buffalo? Try the sampler and you will get a good sampling of a variety of unusual foods. The servers here were wonderful and answered many questions about the food and Sedona . A fun place to go for lunch!

A nice place to sit and enjoy the area. We sat outside and loved the beautiful weather we had. The food was great and the staff was fast and pleasant.

Good selection of wild game and domestic food on menu. Prices were reasonable, other than slight mixup on order would visit again.

We went here for lunch based on what we read on the Web. The service was average and the Prickly Pear margarita was not as good as their sister restaurant, The Barking Frog. On the bright side, my wife had the Elk Chops which were very good and I had the Buffalo Burger, also very tasty.

The menu and restaurant were from th past. A favorite of the movie stars and their stories when they filmed in the area. The menu was fine, service was so-so, and the meal was just OK! Stil was a fun place to go!
